subject: WIP: Replication CG Integration Phase 1
commit_message:
WIP: Replication CG Integration Phase 1

In phase 1 of the replication CG integration, we are making
changes in the replication functions of the volume manager
and driver to handle volumes in a replication CG. No Cinder
API change is involved in this phase.

Spec is proposed here: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/229722/

Here are the steps to create a replication CG:

- Admin sets up volume type A that supports replication and CG.
  volume_type_A must have the following extra_spec as well as other
  things required by the driver:

      replication_enabled: <is> True

- User creates a CG with the potential to support replication by
  specifying volume_type_A.

cinder consisgroup-create --name 'replication_cg' volume_type_A

The scheduler will choose a backend that reports both
consistencygroup_support = True and replication_enabled = True.

- User creates a volume and adds to CG.

cinder create --name 'replication_cg_vol_1'
              --volume-type volume_type_A
              --consisgroup-id <CG uuid>

- Repeat until all volumes are created for the CG.

- Enable replication CG, assuming the CLI is as follows:

cinder replication-enable <volume uuid>

This will enable replication for all volumes in the replication CG.

The above example starts with an empty CG. For other cases such as
create CG from source, update CG, etc., I think we need to make a
few more changes to prevent user error.

Co-Authored-By: xing-yang <xing.yang@emc.com>
Co-Authored-By: John Griffith <john.griffith8@gmailcom>

Change-Id: Ic96fcf0beb84f3b6c651d7ea271c96ba5e953ba9

subject: Refactor the rpc callback version discovery mechanism
commit_message:
Refactor the rpc callback version discovery mechanism

The previous version depended on the AgentDbMixin to be loaded by
any plugin, and also introduced an __init__ on the mixin which
was problematic: mixins are expected to be classes which add methods
to another class, but to implement no constructor. One of the plugins
had one of the elements of MRO not calling to super().__init__ and
hence not triggering this __init__ method.

This change requires the plugins using the rpc callback mechanism
to provide the AgentDbMixin which is used to refresh cache of known
resource consumers (agents) and versions on demand, this way
we make it more clear that the rpc_callback api is currently designed
to be used with agents only, despite of its extensibility to other
areas.

subject: Add simple test for Neutron GET /
commit_message:
Add simple test for Neutron GET /

A fundamental operation for most OpenStack services is providing
information about what versions of an API are available to clients.
A version document can be retrieved by sending an unauthenticated
GET request to the root URL ("/") for most services, including
Neutron.  This capability is important for discovery in that clients
can learn how to interact with the cloud in question, and DefCore
considers it an important capability for interoperability and has
added similar capabilities to it's Guidelines for other services.[1][2]
As Neutron moves toward microversioning [3], being able to retrieve
a version document will be increasingly important for clients.
However, there are currently no tests for GET /, so DefCore cannot
make this a required Capability.

This patch adds a simple test for GET / that performs checks on
document structure and version information.

[1] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/defcore/tree/2016.01.json#n117
[2] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/defcore/tree/2016.01.json#n1379
[3] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/newton-neutron-future-neutron-api

Closes-Bug: #1577410

subject: Add index on trunk_id in the subports model
commit_message:
Add index on trunk_id in the subports model

An index on trunk_id will make queries that return subports from a given
trunk_id efficient.  When I first approved the trunk and subports model,
I thought that having trunk_id in the primary key would be sufficient.
However, thinking about it some more, I realize that isn't the case
because trunk_id is listed as the second column in the primary key.

Think about it like searching a string index for something that matches
in the last half of a string.  The index doesn't make that efficient.
The DB must still search all entries for matches.  It is the same with
the index on (port_id, trunk_id) that the primary key provides.  You
need to look through every row to find matching trunk_ids.  Hence the
addition of an index.

This changes the scope validation to occur after a token has already
been created.

Previous flow:

1. Validate authentication options.

3. Create a token (using authentication + authorization options)

applied in step 3 by Keystone.

New flow:

1. Validate authentication options.
2. Create token (using authentication + authorization options)
3  Validate authorization options if the command requires a scope and

subject: WIP Extend ResourceProvider to have resources and aggregates
commit_message:
WIP Extend ResourceProvider to have resources and aggregates

There are pending discussion on how to make this work as
effectively as possible, so this is not a final design,
just a place to flesh out the ideas and explore where we've
had communication gaps.

A ResourceProvider now provides a facade over an Inventory, a
ResourceProviderAggregate and an Allocation. It is possible to
create a ResourceProvider, update its associated aggregates, and
inspect its associated inventories.

Associated aggregates are updated under the domain of the
object updating itself. Inventory is updated by independently
creating Inventory objects with the correctly associated resource
provider.

aggregates and resources are loaded lazily

When a ResourceProvider is destroyed the inventories and
ResourceProviderAggregates associated with it are destroyed too
but only if there are no allocations (if used == 0).

A ResourceProviderList now exists with a single classmethod to
get_all(), which will construct ResourceProvider objects for all
ResourceProviders that are not compute nodes. This satisfies the
needs of the resource pools api. The disjoint in name may need to
be resolved, if we care.

As most of the functionality involved here is driven by joins across
multiple tables the tests are hosted under the functional tree.

Partially-Implements: blueprint generic-resource-pools

subject: Work around Nova blocking openstack-core stop
commit_message:
Work around Nova blocking openstack-core stop

When we try to stop openstack-core-clone pacemaker resource, Nova
services still want to be started by Pacemaker, and crm_resource --wait
never returns.

`crm_resource --wait -VVV` keeps printing:

   notice: LogActions:   Start openstack-nova-scheduler:0      (overcloud-controller-0)
   notice: LogActions:   Start openstack-cinder-volume (overcloud-controller-0 - blocked)
   notice: LogActions:   Start openstack-nova-api:0    (overcloud-controller-0)
   notice: LogActions:   Start openstack-nova-conductor:0      (overcloud-controller-0)

This shouldn't happen as the whole Nova resource sub-chain depends on
openstack-core:

[root@overcloud-controller-0 ~]# pcs constraint show | grep nova
  start openstack-core-clone then start openstack-nova-consoleauth-clone (kind:Mandatory)
  start openstack-nova-novncproxy-clone then start openstack-nova-api-clone (kind:Mandatory)
  start openstack-nova-consoleauth-clone then start openstack-nova-novncproxy-clone (kind:Mandatory)
  start openstack-nova-api-clone then start openstack-nova-scheduler-clone (kind:Mandatory)
  start openstack-nova-scheduler-clone then start openstack-nova-conductor-clone (kind:Mandatory)
  openstack-nova-api-clone with openstack-nova-novncproxy-clone (score:INFINITY)
  openstack-nova-novncproxy-clone with openstack-nova-consoleauth-clone (score:INFINITY)
  openstack-nova-scheduler-clone with openstack-nova-api-clone (score:INFINITY)
  openstack-nova-conductor-clone with openstack-nova-scheduler-clone (score:INFINITY)

Explicitly disabling and enabling the Nova resource sub-chain helps as a
workaround.

Root cause is probably https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1327469

subject: Add queue name to notifications
commit_message:
Add queue name to notifications

Currently notifications from Zaqar are very consise and simply represent
messages. Example:
{'body': 'somemessage', 'ttl': 60}

But subscribers are likely to want queue information inside
notifications, if they subscribe to multiple queues.

The only option for subscribers to know from which queue each
notification was sent is to listen on many ports, and make each port
correspond to each particular queue, but it's very inconvenient.

This patch adds queue name to each notification to make notifications
look like this:
{'body': 'somemessage', 'ttl': 60, 'queue_name': 'somequeue'}

Since we only add a new key to JSON dictionary, this patch is backward
compatible.

This patch adds new test case "test_proper_notification_data".
It also modifies "test_mailto" and "test_webhook" test cases, so they
consider undeterministic behavior of "json.dumps" function, which
often serializes dictionaries in different order, making test assertions
sometimes fail.

Closes-Bug: 1535811
